title: Boeing Engineer Who Oversaw 737 MAX Design to Retire
sub_head: Michael Teal was chief engineer during 737 MAX’s development before two of the jets crashed
body:
A senior Boeing Co. engineer who oversaw the design of the 737 MAX is retiring from the plane maker, the company said Friday.
Michael Teal, who was the chief project engineer during the jet’s development, is stepping down on April 1 after 35 years at the aerospace giant.
